data.title: Broken Phone
data.statement: Your phone is broken and you want to buy a new one. The new phone will cost [[f]] $. You are broke and don't have money (0$). Your dad will give you [[g]] $ as a gift. But, your sister will take [[d]] $ from the money to get a toy for herself. Calculate the deduction after your sister took the [[d]] $ from the money and see whether the remaining money is enough to buy a new phone or not.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut:
The remaining money is:1500
I can afford

data.stubGenerator:
read f:int

write The remaining money is:remaining
I can afford or I can't afford
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[f]] represents  how much the new phone cost.
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[g]] represents  how much money your father will give you as a gift.
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[d]] represents  how much your sister will take from the money.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> {{The remaining money is:}}[[remaining]], where [[remaining]] is an integer for the remaining amount of the gift money after your sister's share
<<Line 2:>> {{I can afford}} (if the remaining money is enough to buy the new phone) or {{I can't afford}} (if the remaining money is not enough to buy the new phone).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your phone is broken and you want to buy a new one. The new phone will cost f $. You are broke and don't have money (0$). Your dad will give you g $ as a gift. But, your sister will take d $ from the money to get a toy for herself. Calculate the deduction after your sister took the d $ from the money and see whether the remaining money is enough to buy a new phone or not.
Input
Line 1: An integer f represents how much the new phone cost.
Line 2: An integer g represents how much money your father will give you as a gift.
Line 3: An integer d represents how much your sister will take from the money.
Output
Line 1: The remaining money is:remaining, where remaining is an integer for the remaining amount of the gift money after your sister's share
Line 2: I can afford (if the remaining money is enough to buy the new phone) or I can't afford (if the remaining money is not enough to buy the new phone).
Constraints
f, d< g
Example
Input
1200
2000
500
Output
The remaining money is:1500
I can afford
